rule: 4 Requirements on generating plants
rule_cn: 4 发电设施要求

rule: 4.1 General: This clause defines the requirements on generating plants to be operated in parallel with the distribution network. Where settings or a range of configurability is provided and respecting the legal framework the configurations and settings may be provided by the DSO. Where no settings are provided by the DSO, the specified default settings shall be used; if no default settings are provided, the producer shall propose settings and inform the DSO. The requirements of Clause 4 apply during normal operation of the generating units and do not apply in case of maintenance or units out of operation. The provisions apply to EESS in generation mode. In charging mode EESS should have the same characteristics, unless stated otherwise in the clauses of this European Standard. The applicability is independent of the duration the generating unit operates in parallel with the distribution network. It is the responsibility of the DSO to relax, if deemed appropriate, the requirements for an individual generating unit or plant whose operation in parallel only lasts for a short time (temporary operation in parallel). The relaxed requirements shall be agreed between the DSO and the producer, along with the maximum allowable duration of the temporary operation in parallel. For the short-term parallel operation an appropriate device shall automatically disconnect the generating unit or plant as soon as the maximum allowable duration has elapsed. If different requirements on the generating plant interfere with each other, the following hierarchy in descending order shall be applied: 1. Generating unit protection, including regarding the prime mover; 2. Interface protection (see 4.9) and protection against faults within the generating plant; 3. Voltage support during faults and voltage steps (see 4.7.4); 4. The lower value of: remote control command on active power limitation for distribution grid security (see 4.11) and local response to overfrequency (see 4.6.1); 5. Local response to underfrequency if applicable (see 4.6.2); 6. Reactive power (see 4.7.2) and active power (P(U) see 4.7.2) controls; 7. Other control commands on active power set point for e.g. market, economic reasons, self-consumption optimization. The system shall be so designed that under foreseeable conditions no self-protection trips prior to the fulfilment of the requirements of this European Standard and all settings provided by the DSO or responsible party. For cogeneration plants embedded in industrial sites, active power requirements shall be agreed between the responsible party and the producer. In such a case the priority list is adapted accordingly. Besides the requirements of Clause 4, additional requirements apply for connecting a generating plant to the distribution network, e.g. assessment of the point of connection. However, this is excluded from the scope of this European Standard but some guidance is provided in the informative Annex A. EN 50549-10 provides technical guidance for tests on generating units and interface protection to evaluate their electrical characteristics. EN 50549-10 shall be applied to evaluate the characteristics of generating units and interface protection used in generating plants relating to the requirements of this Standard. Electrical characteristics may alternatively be evaluated according to standards other than EN 50549-10, if the following prerequisites are fulfilled: - The alternative verification procedure covers all required technical aspects and characteristic quantities stipulated in EN 50549-1 and EN 50549-2, respectively. - The alternative verification procedure shall not be less stringent or technically less demanding than the correspondent verification procedure in EN 50549-10. - The alternative verification procedure leads to results of at least equivalent confidence level as EN 50549-10. - The equivalent or higher confidence level of the alternative verification procedure shall be confirmed by the entity stating compliance based upon these tests. - The entity stating compliance based upon these tests shall have sufficient expertise in both EN 50549-10 and the applied standard. NOTE: This also applies for a partial application of another standard only for specific functions or operational capabilities.
rule_cn:
4.1 一般规定：本条款规定了发电设备并网运行时应满足的要求。当提供了设置或可配置范围，并且遵守法律框架时，DSO（配电网运营商）可以提供配置和设置。如果DSO未提供设置，则应使用规定的默认设置；如果未提供默认设置，发电方应提出设置并通知DSO。第4条的要求适用于发电单元的正常运行，不适用于维护或停运情况。本条款适用于发电模式下的ESS（储能系统）。在充电模式下，ESS应具有相同特性，除非本欧洲标准的条款另有规定。本条款的适用性与发电单元并网运行的时间长短无关。如果DSO认为适当，应对仅短时间并网运行（临时并网）的单个发电单元或电厂放松相关要求。放松后的具体要求应由DSO与发电方协商确定，并应包括临时并网运行的最大允许时长。对于短期并网运行，应设置适当的装置，在达到最大允许时长后自动断开发电单元或电厂。如果对发电设备的不同要求之间存在冲突，应按照以下优先级顺序进行处理：  
1. 发电机组保护，包括对原动机的保护；  
2. 接口保护（参见4.9）及发电设备内部故障保护；  
3. 故障及电压阶跃期间的电压支持（参见4.7.4）；  
4. 用于配电网安全的有功功率限制远程控制命令（参见4.11）和过频本地响应（参见4.6.1）中的较低值；  
5. 如适用，欠频的本地响应（参见4.6.2）；  
6. 无功功率（参见4.7.2）和有功功率（P(U) 参见4.7.2）控制；  
7. 其他关于有功功率设定点的控制命令，例如市场、经济原因或自用优化等。  
系统应设计为在可预见的条件下，不会在满足本欧洲标准要求及DSO或相关责任方提供的所有设置之前发生自保护跳闸。对于嵌入在工业场所中的联合循环发电厂，有功功率要求应由责任方与发电方协商确定。在这种情况下，优先级列表应相应调整。除了第4条的要求外，连接发电设备到配电网还可能有其他要求，例如接入点评估。但这些要求不包含在本欧洲标准的适用范围内，但信息性附录A中提供了一些指导。EN 50549-10为对发电设备及其接口保护进行测试提供了技术指导，以评估其电气特性。EN 50549-10应用于评估发电设备及其接口保护的特性，这些特性与本标准的要求相关。如果满足以下前提条件，也可以根据其他标准评估电气特性：  
- 替代验证程序涵盖EN 50549-1和EN 50549-2中规定的全部技术方面和特性量；  
- 替代验证程序不应比EN 50549-10中的对应验证程序更宽松或技术要求更低；  
- 替代验证程序的结果应至少与EN 50549-10具有同等的置信水平；  
- 替代验证程序的同等或更高置信水平应由基于这些测试声明符合性的实体确认；  
- 声称基于这些测试符合性的实体应具备在EN 50549-10和所应用标准方面的足够专业知识。  
注：这同样适用于仅针对特定功能或运行能力部分应用其他标准的情况。

rule: 4.2 Connection scheme: The connection scheme of the generating plant shall be in compliance with the requirements of the DSO. Different requirements may be subject to agreement between the producer and the DSO depending on the power system needs. Inter alia, the generating plant shall ensure the following: synchronization, operation and disconnection under normal network operating conditions, i.e. in the absence of faults or malfunctions; faults and malfunctions within the generating plant shall not impair the normal functioning of the distribution network; coordinated operation of the interface switch with the generating unit switch, the main switch and switches in the distribution network, for faults or malfunctions within the generating plant or the DSO network during operation in parallel with the distribution network; and disconnection of the generating plant from the distribution network by tripping the interface switch according to 4.9. In order to satisfy the above functions, coordinated but independent switches and protection equipment may be applied in the generating plant, as shown in the example in Figure 2.
rule_cn: 4.2 连接方案：发电厂的连接方案应符合DSO的要求。根据电力系统的需求，生产者与DSO之间可能就具体要求达成协议。发电厂应确保以下几点：在正常网络运行条件下（即没有故障或故障的情况下）实现同步、运行和断开；发电厂内部的故障和故障不得影响配电网的正常运行；在与配电网并网运行期间，发电厂内部或DSO网络出现故障或故障时，接口开关与发电机组开关、主开关以及配电网中的开关应协调运行；根据第4.9条的规定，通过跳闸接口开关将发电厂与配电网断开。为满足上述功能，发电厂可采用协调但独立的开关和保护设备，如图2所示示例。
trl:
rule 1
IF Status = 正常网络运行条件 AND Action = 同步运行断开 THEN Status = 实现同步运行断开

rule 2
IF Fault = 发电厂内部故障 AND Action = 出现 THEN Status = 配电网正常运行

rule 3
IF (Fault = 发电厂内部故障 OR Fault = DSO网络故障) AND Action = 并网运行 THEN Protection = 开关协调运行

rule 4
IF Action = 跳闸接口开关 AND Target = 发电厂与配电网 THEN Status = 断开
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 操作 = 同步运行断开 and 状态 = 正常网络运行条件
then 状态 = 实现同步运行断开
rule 2
if 操作 = 出现 and 故障类型 = 发电厂内部故障
then 状态 = 配电网正常运行
rule 3
if 操作 = 并网运行 and 故障类型 = 发电厂内部故障
then 保护机制 = 开关协调运行
rule 4
if 操作 = 并网运行 and 故障类型 = DSO网络故障
then 保护机制 = 开关协调运行
rule 5
if 操作 = 跳闸接口开关 and 操作对象 = 发电厂与配电网
then 状态 = 断开

rule: 4.3 Choice of switchgear
rule_cn: 4.3 开关设备的选择

rule: 4.3.1 General: Switches shall be chosen based on the characteristics of the power system in which they are intended to be installed. For this purpose, the short circuit current at the installation point shall be assessed, taking into account, inter alia, the short circuit current contribution of the generating plant.
rule_cn: 4.3.1 一般规定：开关应根据其拟安装的电力系统的特性进行选择。为此，应评估安装点的短路电流，其中包括发电厂对短路电流的贡献等因素。
trl:
rule 1
IF Fault = 短路电流 AND Action = 评估 THEN Action = 选择开关

rule 2
IF Fault = 发电厂对短路电流贡献 AND Action = 评估 THEN Action = 选择开关
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 操作 = 评估 and 故障类型 = 短路电流
then 操作 = 选择开关
rule 2
if 操作 = 评估 and 故障类型 = 发电厂对短路电流贡献
then 操作 = 选择开关

testcase.故障类型: 发电厂对短路电流贡献
发电厂对短路电流贡献
发电厂对短路电流贡献
发电厂对短路电流贡献

rule: 4.3.2 Interface switch: Switches shall be power relays, contactors or mechanical circuit breakers each having a breaking and making capacity corresponding to the rated current of the generating plant and corresponding to the short circuit contribution of the generating plant. The short-time withstand current of the switching devices shall be coordinated with rated short circuit power at the point of connection. In case of loss of auxiliary supply power to the switchgear, a secure disconnection of the switch is required immediately. Where means of isolation (according to HD 60364-5-551) is not required to be accessible to the DSO at all times, automatic disconnection with single fault tolerance according to 4.13 shall be provided. NOTE 1: For PV-inverters, further requirements are stated in EN 62109–1 and EN 62109–2 with respect to the interface switch. The function of the interface switch might be combined with either the main switch or the generating unit switch in a single switching device. In case of a combination, the single switching device shall be compliant to the requirements of both, the interface switch and the combined main switch or generating unit switch. As a consequence, at least two switches in series shall be present between any generating unit and the POC. NOTE 2: This does not refer to the number of series-connected switches in order to ensure single fault tolerance as required in 4.13 but to the number of different switching devices itself.
rule_cn:
4.3.2 接口开关：开关应为具有相应额定电流和相应发电厂短路贡献能力的电源继电器、接触器或机械式电路断路器。开关装置的短时耐受电流应与连接点的额定短路功率相协调。在开关柜辅助电源失效时，应立即确保开关安全断开。如果隔离装置（根据 HD 60364-5-551）不需要始终对电网运营商（DSO）可访问，则应提供符合第4.13条规定的具有单故障容错能力的自动断开功能。  
注1：对于光伏逆变器，有关接口开关的进一步要求见EN 62109–1和EN 62109–2。接口开关的功能可以与主开关或发电单元开关合并在一个开关装置中。如合并使用，该单一开关装置应满足接口开关以及合并后的主开关或发电单元开关的全部要求。因此，在任何发电单元与公共连接点（POC）之间，至少应有两个串联的开关。  
注2：本条不涉及为确保第4.13条规定的单故障容错能力所需的串联开关数量，而是指不同的开关装置数量。
trl:
rule 1
IF Action = 接口开关运行 AND Target = 开关装置 THEN Protection = 与连接点额定短路功率协调 AND Protection = 短时耐受电流协调

rule 2
IF Fault = 辅助电源失效 AND Action = 接口开关运行 THEN Status = 安全断开

rule 3
IF Status = DSO不可访问 AND Action = 接口开关运行 THEN Protection = 自动断开 AND Protection = 单故障容错能力

rule 4
IF Target = 发电单元与公共连接点 AND Action = 连接 THEN Protection = 至少两个串联开关
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 操作 = 接口开关运行 and 操作对象 = 开关装置
then 保护机制 = 与连接点额定短路功率协调 and 保护机制 = 短时耐受电流协调
rule 2
if 操作 = 接口开关运行 and 故障类型 = 辅助电源失效
then 状态 = 安全断开
rule 3
if 操作 = 接口开关运行 and 状态 = DSO不可访问
then 保护机制 = 自动断开 and 保护机制 = 单故障容错能力
rule 4
if 操作 = 连接 and 操作对象 = 发电单元与公共连接点
then 保护机制 = 至少两个串联开关

testcase.保护机制: 与连接点额定短路功率协调
与连接点额定短路功率协调

rule: 4.4 Normal operating range
rule_cn: 4.4 正常操作范围

rule: 4.4.1 General: Generating plants when generating power shall have the capability to operate in the operating ranges specified below regardless of the topology and the settings of the interface protection.
rule_cn: 4.4.1 一般规定：发电厂在发电时，应具备在下列规定的运行范围内运行的能力，无论系统拓扑结构和接口保护设置如何。
trl:
rule 1
IF (Status = 系统拓扑结构 OR Protection = 接口保护设置) AND Action = 发电 THEN Status = 在下列规定的运行范围内运行
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 操作 = 发电 and 状态 = 系统拓扑结构
then 状态 = 在下列规定的运行范围内运行
rule 2
if 操作 = 发电 and 保护机制 = 接口保护设置
then 状态 = 在下列规定的运行范围内运行

testcase.状态2: 在下列规定的运行范围内运行
在下列规定的运行范围内运行

testcase.状态: 在下列规定的运行范围内运行
在下列规定的运行范围内运行

rule: 4.4.2 Operating frequency range: The generating plant shall be capable of operating continuously when the frequency at the point of connection stays within the range of 49 Hz to 51 Hz. In the frequency range from 47 Hz to 52 Hz the generating plant should be capable of operating until the interface protection trips. Therefore, the generating plant shall at least be capable of operating in the frequency ranges, for the duration and for the minimum requirement as indicated in Table 1. Respecting the legal framework, it is possible that for some synchronous areas more stringent time periods and/or frequency ranges will be required by the DSO and the responsible party. Nevertheless, they are expected to be within the boundaries of the stringent requirement as indicated in Table 1 unless producer, DSO, TSO and responsible party agree on wider frequency ranges and longer durations. NOTE 1: For small isolated distribution networks (typically on islands) even more stringent time periods and frequency ranges may be required. As long as generating modules with linear Sterling engines are recognized as emerging technology according to COMMISSION REGULATION (EU) 2016/631 Title 6, they are permitted to disconnect below 49,5 Hz and above 50,5 Hz. This permission does not affect the requirements for interface protection according to clause 4.9. In this case over and under frequency machine protection might trip prior to interface protection. If an integrated interface protection device is used, the reduction of the configuration range of the interface protection in clause 4.9 is acceptable. NOTE 2: The status of emerging technology in COMMISSION REGULATION (EU) 2016/631 Title 6 depends on the cumulative maximum capacity of this technology. Once the threshold in cumulative maximum capacity is reached the status will be withdrawn.
rule_cn:
4.4.2 运行频率范围：发电设施应在连接点频率保持在49 Hz至51 Hz范围内时，能够连续运行。在47 Hz至52 Hz的频率范围内，发电设施应能够运行直至接口保护装置动作。因此，发电设施至少应能够在表1中所列的频率范围内，持续运行相应的时间和满足最低要求。根据法律框架，某些同步区域可能由电网运营商（DSO）和责任方要求更严格的时间段和/或频率范围。然而，除非发电方、DSO、TSO和责任方同意更宽的频率范围和更长的运行时间，这些要求应符合表1中所列的严格要求。  
注1：对于小型孤立配电网（通常位于岛屿上），可能需要更加严格的时间段和频率范围。只要根据欧盟委员会条例（EU）2016/631第六部分，带有线性斯特林发动机的发电模块被认定为新兴技术，它们允许在低于49.5 Hz和高于50.5 Hz时断开连接。此许可不影响第4.9条中关于接口保护的要求。在这种情况下，过频或欠频的机组保护可能会在接口保护之前动作。如果使用集成式接口保护装置，则第4.9条中接口保护配置范围的缩减是可以接受的。  
注2：根据欧盟委员会条例（EU）2016/631第六部分，新兴技术的状态取决于该技术的累计最大容量。一旦累计最大容量达到阈值，该状态将被取消。
trl:
rule 1
IF Frequency >= 49 AND Frequency <= 51 AND Action = 连续运行 THEN Status = 连续运行
rule 2
IF Frequency >= 47 AND Frequency <= 52 AND Action = 运行 THEN Status = 运行直至接口保护装置动作
rule 3
IF Frequency >= 表1下限 AND Frequency <= 表1上限 AND Action = 运行 THEN Duration = 持续相应时间 AND Protection = 满足最低要求
rule 4
IF (Operator = DSO OR Operator = 责任方) AND Action = 要求 AND Target = 时间段或频率范围 THEN Status = 更严格的时间段和频率范围
rule 5
IF Operator = 发电方 AND Operator = DSO AND Operator = TSO AND Operator = 责任方 AND Action = 同意 THEN Frequency = 更宽频率范围 AND Duration = 更长运行时间
rule 6
IF Target = 小型孤立配电网 AND Action = 需要 THEN Status = 更加严格的时间段和频率范围
rule 7
IF Target = 带有线性斯特林发动机的发电模块 AND Status = 被认定为新兴技术 THEN Status = 允许在低于49.5Hz和高于50.5Hz时断开连接
rule 8
IF Status = 过频或欠频的机组保护 AND Action = 动作 THEN Protection = 在接口保护之前动作
rule 9
IF Action = 使用集成式接口保护装置 THEN Protection = 接口保护配置范围缩减可接受
rule 10
IF Status = 新兴技术 AND PowerResponse = 累计最大容量达到阈值 THEN Status = 状态取消
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 操作 = 连续运行 and 频率 >= 49 and 频率 <= 51
then 状态 = 连续运行
rule 2
if 操作 = 运行 and 频率 >= 47 and 频率 <= 52
then 状态 = 运行直至接口保护装置动作
rule 3
if 操作 = 运行 and 频率 >= 表1下限 and 频率 <= 表1上限
then 保护机制 = 满足最低要求 and Duration = 持续相应时间
rule 4
if 操作 = 要求 and 操作人 = DSO and 操作对象 = 时间段或频率范围
then 状态 = 更严格的时间段和频率范围
rule 5
if 操作 = 要求 and 操作人 = 责任方 and 操作对象 = 时间段或频率范围
then 状态 = 更严格的时间段和频率范围
rule 6
if 操作 = 同意 and 操作人 = 发电方 and 操作人 = DSO and 操作人 = TSO and 操作人 = 责任方
then 频率 = 更宽频率范围 and Duration = 更长运行时间
rule 7
if 操作 = 需要 and 操作对象 = 小型孤立配电网
then 状态 = 更加严格的时间段和频率范围
rule 8
if 状态 = 被认定为新兴技术 and 操作对象 = 带有线性斯特林发动机的发电模块
then 状态 = 允许在低于49.5Hz和高于50.5Hz时断开连接
rule 9
if 操作 = 动作 and 状态 = 过频或欠频的机组保护
then 保护机制 = 在接口保护之前动作
rule 10
if 操作 = 使用集成式接口保护装置
then 保护机制 = 接口保护配置范围缩减可接受
rule 11
if 状态 = 新兴技术 and 功率响应 = 累计最大容量达到阈值
then 状态 = 状态取消

rule: 4.4.3 Minimal requirement for active power delivery at underfrequency: A generating plant shall be resilient to the reduction of frequency at the point of connection while reducing the maximum active power as little as possible. The admissible active power reduction due to underfrequency is limited by the full line in Figure 5 and is characterized by a maximum allowed reduction rate of 10 % of Pmax per 1 Hz for frequencies below 49,5 Hz. It is possible that a more stringent power reduction characteristic is required by the responsible party. Nevertheless this requirement is expected to be limited to an admissible active power reduction represented by the dotted line in Figure 5 which is characterised by a reduction rate of 2 % of the maximum power Pmax per 1 Hz for frequencies below 49 Hz. If any technologies intrinsic design or ambient conditions have influence on the power reduction behaviour of the system, the manufacturer shall specify at which ambient conditions the requirements can be fulfilled and eventual limitations. The information can be provided in the format of a graph showing the intrinsic behaviour of the generating unit for example at different ambient conditions. The power reduction and the ambient conditions shall comply with the specification given by the responsible party. If the generating unit does not meet the power reduction at the specified ambient conditions, the producer and the responsible party shall agree on acceptable ambient conditions.
rule_cn: 4.4.3 在频率下降时的有功功率最小输送要求：发电厂应具备在连接点频率下降时保持稳定的性能，同时尽可能减少最大有功功率的削减。由于频率下降导致的允许有功功率削减受到图5中全线的限制，并且对于低于49.5赫兹的频率，其最大允许削减速率为每1赫兹削减Pmax的10%。有可能负责方会要求更为严格的功率削减特性。然而，这一要求预计将限制在图5中虚线所示的允许有功功率削减范围内，该虚线特性表现为对于低于49赫兹的频率，每1赫兹允许削减Pmax的2%。如果任何技术的固有设计或环境条件会影响系统的功率削减行为，制造商应说明在何种环境条件下可以满足这些要求以及可能的限制。相关信息可以以图表形式提供，例如展示发电单元在不同环境条件下的固有行为。功率削减和环境条件应符合负责方指定的规定。如果发电单元在指定的环境条件下无法满足功率削减要求，生产商和负责方应就可接受的环境条件达成一致。

rule 6
IF Manufacturer = 生产商 AND Action = 说明 THEN Target = 满足要求的环境条件 AND Status = 可能的限制
rule 7
IF PowerResponse = 功率削减 AND Target = 环境条件 THEN Status = 符合负责方指定规定
rule 8

rule: 4.4.4 Continuous operating voltage range: When generating power, the generating plant shall be capable of operating continuously when the voltage at the point of connection stays within the range of 85 % Un to 110 % Un. Beyond these values the under and over voltage ride through immunity limits as specified in clause 4.5.3 and 4.5.4 shall apply. In case of voltages below Un, it is allowed to reduce the apparent power to maintain the current limits of the generating plant. The reduction shall be as small as technically feasible. For this requirement all phase to phase voltages and in case a neutral is connected, additionally all phase to neutral voltages shall be evaluated. NOTE: The specified accepted reduction of output power is an absolute minimum requirement. Further power system aspects might require maintained output power in the entire continuous operation voltage range. The producer shall take into account the typical voltage rise and voltage drop within the generating plant.
rule_cn:
4.4.4 连续运行电压范围：在发电过程中，发电厂应能够在连接点电压处于85% Un至110% Un范围内连续运行。超出这些值时，应按照第4.5.3条和第4.5.3条规定的欠电压和过电压穿越免疫限值进行处理。在电压低于Un的情况下，允许减少视在功率以保持发电厂的电流限制。减少的幅度应尽可能小。对于此要求，应评估所有相间电压；如果连接了中性点，还应评估所有相与中性点之间的电压。  
注：规定的输出功率允许减少量是一个绝对最低要求。电力系统其他方面可能要求在整个连续运行电压范围内维持输出功率。发电厂应考虑发电厂内部典型的电压升高和电压下降情况。

rule 8
IF (Target = 发电厂内部电压升高 OR Target = 发电厂内部电压下降) THEN Status = 考虑内部电压变化

rule: 4.5 Immunity to disturbances
rule_cn: 4.5 抗干扰能力

rule: 4.5.1 General: In general, generating plants should contribute to overall power system stability by providing immunity towards dynamic voltage changes unless safety standards require a disconnection. The following clauses describe the required immunity for generating plants taking into account the connection technology of the generating modules. The following withstand capabilities shall be provided regardless of the settings of the interface protection. NOTE: An event on the HV and EHV transmission network can affect numerous small scale units on MV and LV level. Depending on the penetration of dispersed generation, a significant loss of active power provision can be caused. The described immunity requirements are independent of the interface protection settings. Disconnection settings of the interface protection relay always overrule technical capabilities. So, whether the generating plant will stay connected or not will also depend upon those settings.
rule_cn: 4.5.1 一般规定：通常情况下，发电厂应通过提供对动态电压变化的抗扰能力，有助于整个电力系统的稳定性，除非安全标准要求断开连接。以下条款描述了发电厂所需的抗扰能力，这些能力考虑了发电模块的连接技术。无论接口保护装置的设置如何，都应提供以下承受能力。注意：高压（HV）和特高压（EHV）输电网络上的事件可能会影响中压（MV）和低压（LV）层级上的大量小型发电单元。根据分布式发电的渗透率，可能会造成显著的有功功率供应损失。所描述的抗扰要求与接口保护装置的设置无关。接口保护继电器的断开设置始终优先于技术能力。因此，发电厂是否保持连接也取决于这些设置。
trl:
rule 1
IF Action = 提供抗扰能力 AND Target = 动态电压变化 THEN Status = 有助于电力系统稳定性
rule 2
IF Protection = 安全标准要求断开连接 THEN Status = 断开连接
rule 3
IF Action = 提供抗扰能力 AND Target = 发电模块连接技术 THEN Status = 满足所需抗扰能力
rule 4
IF Protection = 接口保护装置设置无关 THEN Status = 提供承受能力
rule 5
IF Target = HV事件 OR Target = EHV事件 THEN Status = 影响MV和LV小型发电单元
rule 6
IF Target = 分布式发电渗透率 THEN Status = 可能造成显著有功功率损失
rule 7
IF Action = 抗扰 THEN Protection = 与接口保护设置无关
rule 8
IF Protection = 接口保护继电器断开设置 THEN Status = 优先于技术能力
rule 9
IF Status = 保持连接 THEN Protection = 取决于接口保护设置

rule: 4.5.2 Rate of change of frequency (ROCOF) immunity: ROCOF immunity of a power generating plant means that the generating modules in this plant stay connected with the distribution network and are able to operate when the frequency on the distribution network changes with a specified ROCOF. The generating units and all elements in the generating plant that might cause their disconnection or impact their behaviour shall have the same level of immunity. The generating modules in a generating plant shall have ROCOF immunity to ROCOF equal or exceeding the value specified by the responsible party. If no ROCOF immunity value is specified, at least 2 Hz/s shall apply. The ROCOF immunity is defined with a sliding measurement window of 500 ms. NOTE 1: For control action based on frequency measurement shorter measurement periods are expected to be necessary. NOTE 2: For small isolated distribution networks (typically on islands) higher ROCOF immunity values might be required.
rule_cn:
4.5.2 频率变化率（ROCOF）免疫性：发电厂的频率变化率（ROCOF）免疫性是指该发电厂内的发电模块在配电网频率按照指定的ROCOF变化时，仍能保持与配电网连接并正常运行。发电厂内的所有发电单元以及可能引起其断开或影响其运行行为的其他元件，应具有相同的免疫水平。发电厂内的发电模块应具备对等于或超过责任方所规定的ROCOF值的免疫性。若未规定ROCOF免疫值，则至少应为2 Hz/s。ROCOF免疫性采用500 ms的滑动测量窗口进行定义。  
注1：基于频率测量的控制动作可能需要更短的测量周期。  
注2：对于小型孤立配电网（通常位于岛屿上），可能需要更高的ROCOF免疫值。
trl:
rule 1
IF Frequency = 指定ROCOF变化 AND Action = 运行 THEN Status = 保持连接并正常运行
rule 2
IF Target = 发电单元 AND Action = 运行 THEN Status = 免疫水平相同
rule 3
IF Frequency >= 责任方规定ROCOF值 AND Action = 运行 THEN Status = 具备ROCOF免疫性
rule 4
IF Frequency >= 2 AND Action = 运行 THEN Status = 至少满足最低ROCOF免疫性
rule 5
IF Duration = 500ms AND Action = 测量 THEN Status = 定义ROCOF免疫性
rule 6
IF Target = 频率测量 AND Action = 控制 THEN Duration = 更短测量周期
rule 7
IF Target = 小型孤立配电网 AND Action = 需要 THEN Status = 更高ROCOF免疫值

then 状态 = 保持连接并正常运行
rule 2

then 状态 = 免疫水平相同
rule 3
if 操作 = 运行 and 频率 >= 责任方规定ROCOF值
then 状态 = 具备ROCOF免疫性
rule 4

then 状态 = 至少满足最低ROCOF免疫性
rule 5

rule: 4.5.3 Under-voltage ride through (UVRT)
rule_cn: 4.5.3 电压跌落穿越（UVRT）

rule: 4.5.3.1 General: Generating modules shall comply with the requirements of 4.5.3.2 and 4.5.3.3. Exempted from this requirement are small generating units below 50 kW of the following generation technologies: CHP, fuel cell, rotating machinery, hydro. NOTE 1: The power threshold of this exemption is expected to be reduced in future or the exception might be deleted completely especially once the installed capacity becomes relevant for the grid stability. The requirements apply to all kinds of faults (1ph, 2ph and 3ph). NOTE 2: A more distinctive differentiation for 1ph, 2ph and 3ph faults is under consideration. NOTE 3: The FRT curves in Figure 6, Figure 7 and Figure 8 describe the minimum requirements for continued connection of the generating plant to the grid. They are not designed for parameterising the interface protection.
rule_cn:
4.5.3.1 一般规定：发电模块应符合4.5.3.2和4.5.3.3的要求。以下发电技术的小型发电单元（功率低于50 kW）可免除此要求：联合供热发电（CHP）、燃料电池、旋转机械、水力发电。  
注1：该豁免的功率门槛预计将在未来降低，或者该例外可能被完全取消，特别是当安装容量对电网稳定性变得相关时。  
注2：对单相、两相和三相故障的区分正在考虑进一步明确。  
注3：图6、图7和图8中的FRT曲线描述了发电单元持续接入电网的最低要求。这些曲线并非用于接口保护的参数设置。
trl:

rule 5
IF Operator = 小型发电单元 AND Target = 水力发电 THEN Status = 免除一般规定

then 状态 = 满足一般规定

if 操作人 = 小型发电单元 and 操作对象 = 联合供热发电CHP

rule: 4.5.3.2 Generating plant with non-synchronous generating technology: Generating modules shall be capable of remaining connected to the distribution network as long as the voltage at the point of connection remains above the voltage-time curve of Figure 6. The voltage is relative to Un. The smallest phase to neutral voltage, or if no neutral is present, the smallest phase to phase voltage shall be evaluated. The responsible party may define a different UVRT characteristic. Nevertheless, this requirement is expected to be limited to the most stringent curve as indicated in Figure 6. This means that the whole generating module has to comply with the UVRT requirement. This includes all elements in a generating plant: the generating units and all elements that might cause their disconnection. For the generating unit, this requirement is considered to be fulfilled if it stays connected to the distribution grid as long as the voltage at its terminals remains above the defined voltage-time diagram. After the voltage returns to continuous operating voltage range, 90 % of pre-fault power or available power whichever is the smallest shall be resumed as fast as possible, but at the latest within 1 s unless the DSO and the responsible party requires another value.
rule_cn: 4.5.3.2 非同步发电技术的发电设施：发电模块应在连接点电压高于图6所示的电压-时间曲线时，能够保持与配电网的连接。电压相对于Un。应评估最小的相-中性电压，如果没有中性点，则评估最小的相-相电压。责任方可以定义不同的UVRT特性曲线。然而，这一要求预期应限制在图6中所指示的最严格曲线。这意味着整个发电模块必须符合UVRT要求。这包括发电厂中的所有元件：发电单元以及可能导致其断开的所有元件。对于发电单元，如果其在终端电压保持在定义的电压-时间曲线之上时能够保持与配电网连接，则认为满足该要求。电压恢复到连续运行电压范围后，应尽快恢复至故障前功率或可用功率中的较小值的90%，但最迟应在1秒内完成恢复，除非DSO和责任方另有要求。
trl:
rule 1
IF Voltage > 电压时间曲线 AND Operator = 发电模块
THEN Status = 保持连接
rule 2
IF Voltage 恢复到 连续运行电压范围 AND Operator = 发电模块
THEN PowerResponse = 故障前功率或可用功率的90% AND Duration <= 1s

rule 1
if 电压 > 电压时间曲线 and 操作人 = 发电模块
then 状态 = 保持连接
rule 2

then 功率响应 = 故障前功率或可用功率的90% and Duration <= 1s

testcase.电压: 恢复到连续运行电压范围
testcase.功率响应: 故障前功率或可用功率的90%

rule: 4.5.3.3 Generating plant with synchronous generating technology: Generating modules shall be capable of staying connected to the distribution network as long as the voltage at the point of connection remains above the voltage-time curve of Figure 7. The voltage is relative to Un. The smallest phase to neutral voltage or if no neutral is present the smallest phase to phase voltage shall be evaluated. The responsible party may define a different UVRT characteristic. Nevertheless, this requirement is expected to be limited to the most stringent curve, indicated in Figure 7. This means that the whole generating module has to comply with the UVRT requirement. This includes all elements in a generating plant: the generating units and all elements that might cause their disconnection. For the generating unit, this requirement is considered to be fulfilled if it stays connected to the distribution grid as long as the voltage at its terminals remains above the defined voltage-time diagram. After the voltage returns to continuous operating voltage range, 90 % of pre-fault power or available power whichever is the smallest shall be resumed as fast as possible, but at the latest within 3 s unless the DSO and the responsible party requires another value.
rule_cn: 4.5.3.3 具备同步发电技术的发电设施：发电模块应在连接点电压高于图7所示的电压-时间曲线时，保持与配电网的连接。电压相对于Un进行计算。应评估最小的相-中性电压，若无中性点则评估最小的相-相电压。责任方可以定义不同的UVRT特性曲线。然而，这一要求应限于图7中所示的最严格曲线。这意味着整个发电模块必须满足UVRT要求。这包括发电设施中的所有元件：发电单元以及可能导致其断开的所有元件。对于发电单元而言，只要其终端电压高于规定的电压-时间曲线，即认为满足该要求。电压恢复至连续运行电压范围后，应尽快恢复至故障前功率或可用功率中的较小值的90%，但最迟应在3秒内完成恢复，除非DSO（配电系统运营商）和责任方要求其他数值。
trl:
rule 1
IF Voltage > 电压-时间曲线 AND Operator = 发电模块
THEN Status = 保持连接
rule 2
IF Voltage恢复至连续运行电压范围 AND Operator = 发电模块
THEN PowerResponse = 恢复至故障前功率或可用功率较小值的90% AND Duration <= 3s

rule 1

then 状态 = 保持连接
rule 2

testcase.约束: 电压恢复至连续运行电压范围
testcase.功率响应: 恢复至故障前功率或可用功率较小值的90%

rule: 4.5.4 Over-voltage ride through (OVRT): Generating modules shall be capable of staying connected to the distribution network as long as the voltage at the point of connection remains below the voltage-time curve of Figure 8. The highest phase to neutral voltage or if no neutral is present the highest phase to phase voltage shall be evaluated. In case of pre-fault voltages below nominal voltage and a voltage step of more than 25 % Un disconnection is allowed. This means that not only the generating units shall comply with this OVRT requirement but also all elements in a generating plant that might cause its disconnection. Exempted from this requirement are small generating units below 50 kW of the following generation technologies: CHP, fuel cell, rotating machinery, hydro. NOTE 1: Exemption is acceptable for CHP, fuel cell, and generating units based on rotating machinery below 50 kW as EN 50465 for gas appliance requests disconnection in case of over voltage. NOTE 2: This is a minimum requirement. Further power system stability aspects might be relevant. The technical discussion is still ongoing. A voltage jump of +10 % of Uc from any stable point of operation is considered. In case of steady-state voltages near the maximum voltage before the event, this will result in an over voltage situation for many seconds. In later editions of this document, more stringent immunity might be required.
rule_cn:
4.5.4 过电压穿越（OVRT）：发电模块应在连接点电压低于图8所示的电压-时间曲线时，能够保持与配电网的连接。应评估最高相-中性电压，若无中性点则评估最高相-相电压。在故障前电压低于额定电压且电压突变超过25% Un的情况下，允许断开连接。这意味着不仅发电单元应符合此OVRT要求，发电厂中可能导致其断开的所有元件也应符合该要求。以下发电技术的小型发电单元（低于50kW）可免除此要求：联合供热（CHP）、燃料电池、旋转机械、水电。  
注1：对于CHP、燃料电池以及基于旋转机械的小型发电单元（低于50kW），免除要求是可接受的，因为EN 50465对燃气设备在过电压情况下要求断开连接。  
注2：此为最低要求。其他电力系统稳定性方面可能也相关。技术讨论仍在进行中。从任何稳定运行点出发，电压上升10% Uc的情况被视为电压突变。如果在事件发生前，稳态电压接近最大电压，则可能导致数秒的过电压情况。在该文件的后续版本中，可能要求更严格的抗扰度。
trl:
rule 1
IF Voltage < 图8电压时间曲线 AND Operator = 发电模块
THEN Status = 保持连接
rule 2
IF Voltage < 额定电压 AND Voltage突变 > 25% Un
THEN Status = 允许断开连接
rule 3
IF Target = 小型发电单元 AND Target功率 < 50kW AND (Target = CHP OR Target = 燃料电池 OR Target = 旋转机械 OR Target = 水电)
THEN Status = 可免除OVRT要求

then 状态 = 保持连接

rule 4

then 状态 = 可免除OVRT要求

then 状态 = 可免除OVRT要求

rule: 4.5.5 Phase jump immunity: Phase jump immunity of a power generating plant means that the generating modules in this plant stay connected with the distribution network and are able to operate during and after the occurrence of a phase jump. The generating units and all elements in the generating plant that might cause their disconnection or impact their behaviour shall have the same level of immunity. The generating modules in a generating plant shall have phase jump immunity equal to or exceeding 20° in case of a symmetrical phase jump. After the phase jump, 90 % of pre-fault power or available power whichever is the smallest shall be resumed as fast as possible, but at the latest within 3 s in case of synchronous generating technologies and within 1 s in case of non-synchronous generating technologies. NOTE 1: Asymmetrical phase jumps as present in case of phase to phase faults are included in the requirement of UVRT. NOTE 2: Generating units based on converter connected generation technology are typically immune to phase jumps up to 50°. NOTE 3: The 20° value is considered a state of the art immunity present for all generating technologies. System studies currently in preparation might result in the need for higher immunity levels for the next edition of this standard.
rule_cn:
4.5.5 相位跳变免疫性：发电厂的相位跳变免疫性是指该发电厂中的发电模块在发生相位跳变时及之后仍能够保持与配电网络的连接并正常运行。发电单元以及发电厂中可能导致其断开或影响其运行的所有元件，应具有相同的免疫水平。在发生对称性相位跳变的情况下，发电厂中的发电模块应具有至少20°的相位跳变免疫性。相位跳变发生后，应尽快恢复至故障前功率或可用功率中较小的那个值的90%，对于同步发电技术，最迟应在3秒内恢复；对于非同步发电技术，最迟应在1秒内恢复。  
注1：不对称相位跳变（如相间故障时所出现的情况）包含在电压跌落（UVRT）的要求中。  
注2：基于换流器连接发电技术的发电单元通常对相位跳变具有高达50°的免疫性。  
注3：20°的数值被认为是目前所有发电技术普遍具备的免疫水平。目前正在进行的系统研究可能会导致本标准下一次修订时需要更高的免疫水平。
trl:
rule 1
IF Target = 发电模块 AND Fault = 相位跳变 AND Operator = 发电厂
THEN Status = 保持连接 AND PowerResponse = 正常运行
rule 2
IF Fault = 对称性相位跳变
THEN Fault = 相位跳变免疫性 >= 20°
rule 3
IF Fault = 相位跳变 AND Target = 发电模块 AND Operator = 发电厂

rule 4
IF Fault = 相位跳变 AND Target = 发电模块 AND Operator = 发电厂
THEN PowerResponse = 恢复至故障前功率或可用功率中较小值的90% AND Duration <= 1s

rule: 4.6 Active response to frequency deviation
rule_cn: 4.6 频率偏差的主动响应

rule: 4.6.1 Power response to overfrequency: Generating plants shall be capable of activating active power response to overfrequency at a programmable frequency threshold f1 at least between and including 50,2 Hz and 52 Hz with a programmable droop in a range of at least s=2 % to s=12 %. The droop reference is Pref. Unless defined differently by the responsible party: Pref=Pmax, in the case of synchronous generating technology and electrical energy storage systems. Pref=PM, the actual AC output power at the instant when the frequency reaches the threshold f1, in the case of all other non-synchronous generating technology. The power value calculated according to the droop is a maximum power limit. If e.g. the available primary power decreases during a high frequency period below the power defined by the droop function, lower power values are permitted. With ΔP=(1/s)·((f1-f)/fn)·Pref, where f is the actual frequency, the maximum power limit is: Pmax-limit=PM+ΔP. NOTE 1: In other documents power response to overfrequency can also be described as frequency control or Limited Frequency Sensitive Mode - Overfrequency (LFSM-O). NOTE 2: The active power droop relative to the reference power might also be defined as an active power gradient relative to the reference power. A droop in the range of 2 % to 12 % represents a gradient of 100 % to 16,7 % Pref /Hz so with g defined by g[P/Pref / Hz]=(1/(s·fn)) we get ΔP=g·Pref·(f1-f). The generating plant shall be capable of activating active power response to overfrequency as fast as technically feasible with an intrinsic dead time that shall be as short as possible with a maximum of 2 s. An intentional delay shall be programmable to adjust the dead time to a value between the intrinsic dead time and 2 s. The response time shall be as fast as technically feasible. EXAMPLE: - The following response times are considered technically feasible for specific generating technologies. - For PV and battery inverters below 1 s for ΔP of 100 % Pmax. - For wind turbines 2 s for ΔP<50 % Pmax. - For combustion engines, gas turbines, fuel cells below 2 MW 66 % /min for a 100 % change. - For combustion engines, gas turbines, fuel cells above 2 MW 20 % /min for a 100 % change. After activation, the active power frequency response shall use the actual frequency at any time, reacting to any frequency increase or decrease according to the programmed droop with an accuracy of ± 10 % of the nominal power (see Figure 9). The resolution of the frequency measurement shall be ± 10 mHz or less. The accuracy is evaluated with a 1 min average value. At POC, loads if present in the producer’s network might interfere with the response of the generating plant. The effect of loads is not considered for the evaluation of the accuracy, only the behaviour of the generating plant is relevant. NOTE 4: With the provision above, the intentional delay is only active for the activation of the function, once the function is operating, the established control loop is not intentionally delayed. NOTE 5: The option of an intentional delay is required since a very fast and undelayed active power frequency response in case of loss of mains would correct any excess of generation leading to a generation-consumption balance. In these circumstances, an unintended islanding situation with stable frequency would take place, in which the correct behaviour of any loss of mains detection based on frequency might be hindered. NOTE 6: The intentional delay is considered relevant for power system stability. For that reason, legal regulations might require a mutual agreement on the setting between DSO, responsible party and TSO. Generating plants reaching their minimum regulating level shall, in the event of further frequency increase, maintain this power level constant unless the DSO and the responsible party requires to disconnect the complete plant or if the plant consists of multiple units by disconnecting individual units. The active power frequency response is only deactivated if the frequency falls below the frequency threshold f1. If required by the DSO and the responsible party an additional deactivation threshold frequency fstop shall be programmable in the range of at least 50 Hz to f1. If fstop is configured to a frequency below f1 there shall be no response according to the droop in case of a frequency decrease (see Figure 10). The output power is kept constant until the frequency falls below fstop for a configurable time tstop. If at the time of deactivation of the active power frequency response the momentary active power PM is below the available active power PA, the active power increase of the generating plant shall not exceed the gradient defined in 4.10.2. Settings for the threshold frequency f1, the droop and the intentional delay are provided by the DSO and the responsible party. If no settings are provided, the default settings in Table 2 should be applied. NOTE 7: When applying active power response to overfrequency, the frequency threshold f1 should be set to a value from 50,2 Hz up to 50,5 Hz. Setting the frequency threshold f1 to 52 Hz is considered as deactivating this function.
rule_cn:
4.6.1 对频率过高的功率响应：发电厂应具备在可编程频率阈值 f1（至少在 50.2 Hz 和 52 Hz 之间）激活有功功率响应的能力，其可编程下垂范围应至少为 s=2% 到 s=12%。下垂参考值为 Pref。除非责任方另有规定，否则在同步发电技术和电能存储系统中，Pref=Pmax；在所有其他非同步发电技术中，Pref=PM，即频率达到阈值 f1 时的实际交流输出功率。根据下垂计算出的功率值为最大功率限制。例如，在高频期间，如果可用的一次功率下降到低于下垂函数定义的功率值，则允许较低的功率值。计算公式为 ΔP = (1/s) × ((f1 - f)/fn) × Pref，其中 f 为实际频率，最大功率限制为 Pmax-limit = PM + ΔP。

注 1：在其他文件中，对频率过高的功率响应也可描述为频率控制或有限频率敏感模式 - 高频（LFSM-O）。

注 2：相对于参考功率的有功功率下垂也有可能被定义为相对于参考功率的有功功率梯度。下垂范围在 2% 到 12% 之间，表示梯度为 100% 到 16.7% Pref/Hz。以 g 定义为 g[P/Pref/Hz] = 1/(s·fn)，则 ΔP = g·Pref·(f1 - f)。发电厂应尽可能在技术上可行的时间内激活对频率过高的有功功率响应，其固有死时间应尽可能短，最大不超过 2 秒。有意延迟应可编程，以将死时间调整为介于固有死时间和 2 秒之间的值。响应时间应尽可能快。

示例：
- 对于特定发电技术，以下响应时间被认为是技术上可行的：
  - 对于光伏和电池逆变器，在 ΔP 为 100% Pmax 时，响应时间应低于 1 秒。
  - 对于风力涡轮机，在 ΔP 小于 50% Pmax 时，响应时间为 2 秒。
  - 对于燃烧发动机、燃气轮机和燃料电池，若功率低于 2 MW，则 100% 变化时响应梯度为 66%/分钟。
  - 对于燃烧发动机、燃气轮机和燃料电池，若功率高于 2 MW，则 100% 变化时响应梯度为 20%/分钟。

激活后，有功功率频率响应应随时使用实际频率，根据程序化的下垂进行响应，其精度为额定功率的 ±10%（见图 9）。频率测量的分辨率为 ±10 mHz 或更小。精度评估采用 1 分钟平均值。在 POC（运行控制点）时，如果生产者网络中存在负载，可能会干扰发电厂的响应。评估精度时，不考虑负载的影响，仅考虑发电厂的行为。

注 4：上述规定中，有意延迟仅在功能激活时起作用。一旦功能开始运行，建立的控制回路不会被有意延迟。

注 5：有意延迟的选项是必要的，因为在主电源丢失时，非常快速且无延迟的有功功率频率响应可以纠正任何发电过剩，从而实现发电与消费的平衡。在这种情况下，可能会出现一个稳定的频率下的意外孤岛运行状态，这可能会阻碍基于频率的主电源丢失检测的正确行为。

注 6：有意延迟被认为对电力系统稳定性具有重要意义。因此，法律规范可能要求 DSO（配电系统运营商）、责任方和 TSO（输电系统运营商）之间达成有关设置的相互协议。

当发电厂达到其最小调节水平时，如果频率继续上升，应保持该功率水平不变，除非 DSO 和责任方要求完全断开该电厂，或者该电厂由多个单元组成，通过断开个别单元来实现。只有当频率低于频率阈值 f1 时，有功功率频率响应才会被停用。如果 DSO 和责任方要求，应可编程设置一个额外的停用频率阈值 fstop，其范围至少为 50 Hz 到 f1。如果 fstop 设置在 f1 以下，则在频率下降时将不会根据下垂进行响应（见图 10）。输出功率保持不变，直到频率下降至 fstop 并持续一段时间 tstop。如果在有功功率频率响应停用时，当前有功功率 PM 低于可用有功功率 PA，则发电厂的有功功率增加不得超过 4.10.2 中定义的梯度。

频率阈值 f1、下垂和有意延迟的设置由 DSO 和责任方提供。如果没有提供设置，则应应用表 2 中的默认设置。

注 7：在应用对频率过高的有功功率响应时，频率阈值 f1 应设置为 50.2 Hz 到 50.5 Hz 之间的值。将频率阈值 f1 设置为 52 Hz 被视为停用该功能。

rule: The enabling and disabling of the function and its settings shall be field adjustable and means shall be provided to protect these from unpermitted interference (e.g. password or seal) if required by the DSO and the responsible party. NOTE 8: PV generating units are considered to have the ability to reduce power over the full droop range. NOTE 9: Protection setting overrules this behaviour. Alternatively for the droop function described above, the following procedure is allowed for generating modules if permitted by the DSO and the responsible party: the generating units shall disconnect at randomized frequencies, ideally uniformly distributed between the frequency threshold f1 and 52 Hz; NOTE 10: The usage of a disconnection limit above 51,5Hz does not necessarily imply the requirement to operate at this frequency. Operating range is defined in clause 4.4.4. If the randomized disconnection value is above the operating range and interface protection setting, the unit is disconnected according to chapter 4.9 at the value set by the interface protection. in case the frequency decreases again, the generating unit shall start its reconnection procedure once the frequency falls below the specific frequency that initiated the disconnection; for this procedure, the connection conditions described in 4.10 do not apply; the randomization shall either be at unit level by changing the threshold over time, or on plant level by choosing different values for each unit within a plant, or on distribution system level if the DSO specifies a specific threshold for each plant or unit connected to its distribution system. NOTE 11: This procedure could be applied for generating modules for which it is technically not feasible to reduce power with the required accuracy in the required time or for reasons within the distribution network for example to prevent unintentional island operation. NOTE 12: The behaviour will, for a part of the network with many such units, result in a similar droop as specified above for controllable generating units and hence will provide for the necessary power system stability. Due to its fast reaction capability it contributes significantly to the avoidance of a frequency overshoot. EES units upon reaching zero power output shall continue to follow the configured droop by switching into charging mode. EES units that are in charging mode shall increase the charging power according to the configured droop. In both cases, the minimum regulating level is considered as the maximum charging power taking the state of charge of the storage into account. In case the maximum charging capacity is reached or to prevent any other risk of injury or damage of equipment, a reduction of charging power is permitted. NOTE 13: In this context charging is regarded as a point of operation with negative active power output. If required by the DSO and the responsible party a mode shall be available where an EES upon reaching zero power will remain at zero power and will not switch into charging mode and an EES unit that is in charging mode shall keep the charging power constant. DC coupled storage integrated into the DC side of a generating unit are exempted from this requirement, if they are not capable of charging from AC. These exempted units upon reaching zero power shall remain at zero power and shall not switch into charging mode.
rule_cn:
该功能及其设置的启用与禁用应在现场可调整，如果DSO（调度机构）和相关责任方有要求，应提供保护措施以防止未经授权的干扰（例如密码或封印）。  
**注8**：光伏发电单元被认为具备在整个下垂特性范围内减少功率的能力。  
**注9**：保护设置将覆盖上述行为。  
**替代方案**：对于上述下垂功能，如果DSO和相关责任方允许，发电模块可按照以下程序进行断开操作：发电单元应在频率阈值f1与52Hz之间随机化频率断开，理想情况下均匀分布；  
**注10**：使用高于51.5Hz的断开限制并不一定意味着必须在该频率下运行。运行范围在第4.4.4条中定义。如果随机断开值高于运行范围和接口保护设置，则根据第4.9章在接口保护设置的值下断开。如果频率再次下降，发电单元应在频率低于导致断开的特定频率时启动重新连接程序；对于此程序，第4.10条所述的连接条件不适用；随机化应在单元级别通过随时间改变阈值实现，或在电站级别通过为每个单元选择不同的值实现，或在配电网级别实现，如果DSO为连接到其配电网的每个电站或单元指定了特定阈值。  
**注11**：此程序可适用于那些由于技术原因无法在规定时间内以足够精度降低功率的发电模块，或者出于配电网原因（例如防止意外孤岛运行）而无法实现精确功率调节的发电模块。  
**注12**：在包含大量此类单元的网络部分，该行为将导致与可控发电单元所规定的下垂特性相似的效果，从而提供必要的电力系统稳定性。由于其快速响应能力，它对防止频率过冲有显著贡献。  
当储能单元（EES）达到零功率输出时，应继续按照配置的下垂特性切换到充电模式进行运行。处于充电模式的储能单元应根据配置的下垂特性增加充电功率。在这两种情况下，最低调节水平被视为考虑储能状态的最高充电功率。如果达到最高充电容量或为防止任何其他设备损坏或人身伤害的风险，允许降低充电功率。  
**注13**：在此上下文中，充电被视为具有负有功功率输出的操作点。如果DSO和相关责任方有要求，应提供一种模式：当储能单元达到零功率输出时，应保持在零功率输出状态，并不切换到充电模式；处于充电模式的储能单元应保持充电功率不变。  
如果储能单元是集成在发电单元直流侧的直流耦合储能，且无法从交流侧充电，则可免除上述要求。这些被豁免的储能单元在达到零功率输出时应保持在零功率输出状态，并不切换到充电模式。

rule: 4.6.2 Power response to underfrequency: EES units shall be capable of activating active power response to underfrequency. Other generating units/plants should be capable of activating active power response to underfrequency. If active power to underfrequency is provided by a generating plant/unit, the function shall comply with the requirements below. NOTE 1: In other documents power response to underfrequency is also described as frequency control or Limited Frequency Sensitive Mode - Underfrequency (LFSM-U). Active power response to underfrequency shall be provided when all of the following conditions are met: when generating, the generating unit is operating at active power below its maximum active power Pmax; when generating, the generating unit is operating at active power below the available active power PA; NOTE 2: In case of EES units, the available power includes the state of charge of the storage. the voltages at the point of connection of the generating plant are within the continuous operating voltage range; and when generating, the generating unit is operating with currents lower than its current limit. NOTE 3: These conditions apply to each generating unit individually since the specified conditions need to be met by each generating unit individually to allow the unit to increase power. In the case of EES units, active power frequency response to underfrequency shall be provided in charging and generating mode. NOTE 4: In the case of EES units, the charging is regarded as a point of operation with negative active power. In charging mode the active power consumption is reduced according to the configured droop. Depending on the depth of the underfrequency event a change to generating mode will happen. In this case the state of charge of the storage is part of the conditions above. NOTE 5: This clause provides additional detail to the network code on emergency and restoration (Regulation (EU) 2017/2196) and more precisely on its Article 15 3 (a). The active power response to underfrequency shall be delivered at a programmable frequency threshold f1 at least between and including 49,8 Hz and 46,0 Hz with a programmable droop in a range of at least 2 % to 12 %. The droop reference Pref is Pmax. If the available primary power or a local set value increases during an underfrequency period above the power defined by the droop function, higher power values are permitted. The power value calculated according to the droop is therefore a minimum limit. The minimum power limit is, Pmin-limit=PM+ΔP, with ΔP=(1/s)×((f1-f)/fn)×Pref where f is the actual frequency. NOTE 6: In the case of active power response to underfrequency, Pmax is used as Pref to allow for system support even in case of low power output in the moment the event begins. NOTE 7: The active power droop relative to the reference power might also be defined as an active power gradient relative to the reference power. A droop in the range of 2 % to 12 % represents a gradient of 100 % to 16,7 % Pref /Hz so with g defined by g[P/Pref / Hz]=(1/(s·fn)) we get ΔP=g·Pref·(f1-f). NOTE 8: In the case of an increase of active power generation, the hierarchy of requirements in clause 4.1 apply. The generating unit shall be capable of activating active power response to underfrequency as fast as technically feasible with an intrinsic dead time that shall be as short as possible with a maximum of 2 s and with a step response time of maximum 30 s unless another value is defined by the relevant party. An intentional initial delay shall be programmable to adjust the dead time to a value between the intrinsic dead time and 2 s. After activation, the active power frequency response shall use the actual frequency at any time, reacting to any frequency increase or decrease according to the programmed droop with an accuracy of ± 10 % of the nominal power. The accuracy is evaluated with a 1 min average value. The resolution of the frequency measurement shall be ± 10 mHz or less. At POC loads, if present in the producer’s network, might interfere with the response of the generating plant. The effect of loads is not considered for the evaluation of the accuracy, only the behaviour of the generating plant is relevant. NOTE 9: With the provision above, the intentional delay is only active for the activation of the function, once the function is operating, the established control loop is not intentionally delayed. NOTE 10: The option of an intentional delay is required since a very fast and undelayed active power frequency response in case of loss of mains would correct any shortage of generation leading to a generation-consumption balance. In these circumstances, an unintended islanding situation with stable frequency would take place, in which the correct behaviour of any loss of mains detection based on frequency might be hindered. NOTE 11: The intentional delay is considered relevant for power system stability. For that reason, legal regulations might require a mutual agreement on the setting between DSO, responsible party and TSO. Generating modules reaching any of the conditions above during the provision of active power frequency response shall, in the event of further frequency decrease, maintain this power level constant. The active power frequency response is only deactivated if the frequency increases above the frequency threshold f1. Settings for the threshold frequency f1, the droop and the intentional delay are defined by the DSO and the responsible party, if no settings are provided, the function shall be disabled. NOTE 12: When applying active power response to underfrequency, the frequency threshold f1 should be set to a value from 49,8 Hz up to 49,5 Hz. Setting the frequency threshold f1 to 46 Hz is considered as deactivating this function. The activation and deactivation of the function and its settings shall be field adjustable and means shall be provided to protect these from unpermitted interference (e.g. password or seal) if required by the DSO and the responsible party.
rule_cn:
4.6.2 对频率下降的功率响应：EES 单元应具备在频率下降时启动有功功率响应的能力。其他发电单元/电厂也应具备在频率下降时启动有功功率响应的能力。如果由发电单元/电厂提供频率下降时的有功功率响应，该功能应满足以下要求。  
注 1：在其他文件中，频率下降时的功率响应也被称为频率控制或有限频率敏感模式 - 频率下降（LFSM-U）。当满足以下所有条件时，应提供频率下降时的有功功率响应：在发电时，发电单元的有功功率低于其最大有功功率 Pmax；在发电时，发电单元的有功功率低于可用有功功率 PA；  
注 2：对于 EES 单元，可用功率包括储能系统的充电状态；发电厂接入点的电压在连续运行电压范围内；在发电时，发电单元的电流低于其电流限制。  
注 3：这些条件适用于每个发电单元，因为每个发电单元都需要单独满足这些条件，以便其能够增加功率。对于 EES 单元，在充电和发电模式下均应提供频率下降时的有功功率响应。  
注 4：对于 EES 单元，充电被视为具有负有功功率的运行点。在充电模式下，有功功率消耗会根据配置的下垂特性进行减少。根据频率下降事件的深度，可能会切换到发电模式。在这种情况下，储能系统的充电状态是上述条件的一部分。  
注 5：本条款对网络代码中关于紧急情况和恢复（法规（EU）2017/2196）以及其中第 15 条第 3 款（a）项提供了更详细的说明。频率下降时的有功功率响应应在可编程频率阈值 f1（至少在 49.8 Hz 和 46.0 Hz 之间）处提供，并具有可编程的下垂范围（至少 2% 到 12%）。下垂参考值 Pref 为 Pmax。如果在频率下降期间，可用的一次功率或本地设定值高于下垂函数定义的功率值，允许更高的功率值。因此，根据下垂计算出的功率值是一个最小限制。最小功率限制为 Pmin-limit=PM+ΔP，其中 ΔP=(1/s)×((f1-f)/fn)×Pref，f 为实际频率。  
注 6：在频率下降时的有功功率响应中，使用 Pmax 作为 Pref，以便在事件开始时即使输出功率较低也能提供系统支持。  
注 7：相对于参考功率的有功功率下垂也可以定义为相对于参考功率的有功功率梯度。2% 到 12% 的下垂范围代表 100% 到 16.7% 的 Pref/Hz 梯度。以 g 定义为 g[P/Pref/Hz]=(1/(s·fn))，则 ΔP=g·Pref·(f1-f)。  
注 8：在有功功率增加的情况下，第 4.1 条中的要求优先级适用。发电单元应具备在技术可行的最短时间内启动频率下降时的有功功率响应的能力，其固有死时间应尽可能短，最大为 2 秒，且阶跃响应时间最大为 30 秒，除非相关方另有规定。可编程的有意初始延迟可用于调整死时间，使其在固有死时间和 2 秒之间。启动后，有功功率频率响应应始终使用实际频率，根据编程的下垂特性对任何频率上升或下降做出反应，精度为额定功率的 ±10%。精度评估采用 1 分钟平均值。频率测量的分辨率为 ±10 mHz 或更低。在生产者网络中，如果存在 POC 负荷，可能会干扰发电厂的响应。在评估精度时，不考虑负荷的影响，仅考虑发电单元的行为。  
注 9：根据上述规定，有意延迟仅在功能启动时生效。一旦功能运行，已建立的控制回路不会有意延迟。  
注 10：有意延迟的选项是必要的，因为当主网断开时，非常快速且无延迟的有功功率频率响应可以纠正任何发电不足，从而实现发电与负荷的平衡。在这种情况下，可能会出现一个稳定的频率的非预期孤岛运行状态，这可能会影响基于频率的主网断开检测的正确行为。  
注 11：有意延迟被认为对电力系统稳定性具有重要意义。因此，法律规范可能要求 DSO、责任方和 TSO 之间达成一致，以确定延迟设置。在提供有功功率频率响应期间，如果发电模块达到上述任何条件，当频率进一步下降时，应保持该功率水平不变。只有当频率高于频率阈值 f1 时，有功功率频率响应才会被停用。频率阈值 f1、下垂和有意延迟的设置由 DSO 和责任方定义，如果没有设置，则该功能应被禁用。  
注 12：在应用频率下降时的有功功率响应时，频率阈值 f1 应设置为 49.8 Hz 至 49.5 Hz 之间的某个值。将频率阈值 f1 设置为 46 Hz 被视为禁用该功能。功能的启动、停止及其设置应可在现场进行调整，并应提供保护机制以防止未经授权的干扰（如密码或封条），如果 DSO 和责任方要求的话。
trl:
rule 1
IF Frequency <= f1 AND PowerResponse = 未激活 AND Operator = EES单元
THEN Status = 激活
rule 2
IF Frequency > f1 AND Status = 激活
THEN Status = 停用
rule 3
IF Status = 激活 AND Duration <= 2s
THEN PowerResponse = 可用
rule 4
IF Status = 激活 AND Duration > 固有死时间 AND Duration <= 2s
THEN PowerResponse = 可编程延迟
rule 5
IF Frequency <= f1
THEN PowerResponse = 随实际频率根据下垂响应
rule 6
IF PowerResponse = 运行中
THEN PowerResponse = 精度在额定功率±10%
rule 7
IF FrequencyMeasurement = 进行中
THEN Frequency = ±10mHz分辨率
rule 8
IF Status = 停用 AND PowerResponse < 可用有功功率
THEN PowerResponse = 变化受限
rule 9
IF Frequency >= f1 AND Duration >= tstop
THEN Status = 停用
rule 10
IF Operator = DSO AND Target = 发电厂
THEN Frequency = 由DSO与责任方提供的f1设置
rule 11
IF Operator = DSO AND Target = 发电厂
THEN PowerResponse = 由DSO与责任方提供的下垂设置
rule 12
IF Operator = DSO AND Target = 发电厂
THEN Duration = 由DSO与责任方提供的有意延迟设置

rule 1

if 状态 = 激活 and 频率 > f1

rule: 4.7 Power response to voltage changes
rule_cn: 4.7 电源对电压变化的响应

rule: 4.7.1 General: When the contribution to voltage support is required by the DSO and the responsible party, the generating plant shall be designed to have the capability of managing reactive and/or active power generation according to the requirements of this clause.
rule_cn: 4.7.1 一般规定：当配电系统运营商（DSO）和责任方要求提供电压支持时，发电厂应设计具备根据本条款要求管理无功功率和/或有功功率发电的能力。
trl:
rule 1
IF Operator = DSO AND Target = 发电厂 AND Status = 要求提供电压支持
THEN PowerResponse = 管理无功功率 AND PowerResponse = 管理有功功率
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 状态 = 要求提供电压支持 and 操作人 = DSO and 操作对象 = 发电厂
then 功率响应 = 管理无功功率 and 功率响应 = 管理有功功率

rule: 4.7.2 Voltage support by reactive power
rule_cn: 4.7.2 无功功率提供的电压支持

rule: 4.7.2.1 General: Generating plants shall not lead to voltage changes out of acceptable limits. These limits should be defined by national regulation. Generating units and plants shall be able to contribute to meet this requirement during normal network operation. Throughout the continuous operating frequency (see 4.4.2) and voltage (see 4.4.4) range, the generating plant shall be capable to deliver the requirements stipulated below. Outside these ranges, the generating plant shall follow the requirements as good as technically feasible although there is no specified accuracy required.
rule_cn: 4.7.2.1 一般规定：发电厂不得导致电压超出可接受的范围。这些范围应由国家法规加以规定。发电单元和发电厂应在正常电网运行期间具备满足这一要求的能力。在整个连续运行频率（参见4.4.2）和电压（参见4.4.4）范围内，发电厂应能够满足以下所规定的各项要求。在这些范围之外，发电厂应尽可能按照技术上可行的要求运行，尽管此时并不要求有特定的精度。
trl:
rule 1
IF Operator = 发电厂
THEN Voltage = 不超出可接受范围
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 操作人 = 发电厂
then 电压 = 不超出可接受范围

rule: 4.7.2.2 Capabilities: Figure 12 gives a graphical representation of the minimum and optional capabilities at nominal voltage. Unless specified differently below, for specific generating technologies, generating plants shall be able to operate with active factors as defined by the DSO and the responsible party from active factor=0,90 underexcited to active factor=0,90 overexcited. The reactive power capability shall be evaluated at the terminals of the/each generating unit. CHP generating units with a capacity ≤150 kVA shall be able to operate with active factors as defined by the DSO from cos φ=0,95 underexcited to cos φ=0,95 overexcited. Generating units with an induction generator coupled directly to the grid and used in generating plants above micro generating level, shall be able to operate with active factors as defined by the DSO from cos φ=0,95 underexcited to cos φ=1 at the terminals of the unit. Deviating from 4.7.2.3 only the cos φ set point mode is required. Deviating from the accuracy requirements below, the accuracy is only required at active power PD. Generating units with an induction generator coupled directly to the grid and used in micro generating plants shall operate with an active factor above 0,95 at the terminals of the generating unit. A controlled voltage support by reactive power is not required from this technology. Generating units with linear generators, coupled directly and synchronously to the grid shall operate with an active factor above 0,95 at the terminals of the generating unit, and therefore a controlled voltage support by reactive power is not required from this technology. In case of different generating technologies with different requirements in one generating plant, each unit shall provide voltage support by reactive power as required for its specific technology. A compensation of one technology to reach the general plant requirement is not expected. The DSO and the responsible party may relax the above requirements. This relaxation might be general or specific for a certain generating plant or generating technology. NOTE 1: The generating unit manufacturer has a certain freedom in the sizing of the output side of the generating unit in order to respond to the requirements of this document (e.g. due to voltage changes or reactive power exchange). This is indicated by the Design freedom area in Figure 12. On request, the manufacturer shall provide to all involved parties information documenting the actual choices regarding active power capabilities relative to reactive power requirements and related to the power rating in the operating voltage range (see further in this clause). A P-Q Diagram shall be included in the product documentation of a generating unit. NOTE 2: For additional network support an optional extended reactive power capability according to Figure 12 might be provided by the generating plant, if agreed on between the DSO and the producer and is generally required in some countries for some technologies by legal regulations. NOTE 3: Additional requirements (e.g. continuous Var compensation or continuous reactive power operation disregarding the availability of the primary energy) might be provided by the generating plant, if agreed between the DSO and the producer. NOTE 4: In case of overvoltage, additional reactive power might be exchanged up to the rated current (increasing the apparent power as a consequence), if agreed on between the DSO and the producer. When operating above the apparent power threshold Smin equal to 10 % of the maximum apparent power Smax or the minimum regulating level of the generating plant, whichever is the higher value, the reactive power capability shall be provided with an accuracy of ± 2 % Smax. Up to this apparent power threshold Smin, deviations above 2 % are permissible; nevertheless the accuracy shall always be as good as technically feasible and the exchange of uncontrolled reactive power in this low-power operation mode shall not exceed 10 % of the maximum apparent power Smax. At POC loads, if present in the producer’s network might interfere with the response of the generating plant. The effect of loads is not considered for the evaluation of the accuracy, only the behaviour of the generating plant is relevant. For generating units with a reactive power capability according Figure 12 the reactive power capability at active power PD shall be at least according Figure 13. For generating units with a reduced reactive power capability Figure 13 is only applicable up to the maximum reactive power capability. For voltages below Un it is allowed to reduce apparent power according to 4.4.4. NOTE 6: Whether there is a priority given to P or Q or the active factor when reaching the maximum apparent power this is not defined in this European Standard. Risks and benefits of different priority approaches are under consideration.
rule_cn: 4.7.2.2 功能：图12给出了在额定电压下最小和可选功能的图形表示。除非另有规定，对于特定的发电技术，发电厂应能够按照DSO（配电系统运营商）和相关责任方定义的有功因数，在有功因数=0.90欠励到有功因数=0.90过励之间运行。无功功率能力应在每台发电单元的端子上进行评估。容量≤150 kVA的联合供热发电单元应能够按照DSO定义的有功因数，在cosφ=0.95欠励到cosφ=0.95过励之间运行。直接连接至电网并用于高于微发电级别的发电厂中的感应发电机发电单元，应能够按照DSO定义的有功因数，在单元端子处从cosφ=0.95欠励运行到cosφ=1过励运行。仅在4.7.2.3中有所偏离时，要求cosφ设定点模式。仅在以下精度要求中有所偏离时，精度仅需满足有功功率PD的要求。用于微发电厂中的直接连接至电网的感应发电机发电单元应在发电单元端子处以高于0.95的有功因数运行。该技术不需要通过无功功率进行电压支持。直接且同步连接至电网的线性发电机发电单元应在发电单元端子处以高于0.95的有功因数运行，因此该技术不需要通过无功功率进行电压支持。在一个发电厂中使用不同发电技术且这些技术有不同的要求时，每台发电单元应按照其特定技术的要求提供无功功率电压支持。不期望通过一种技术的补偿来满足整个电厂的总体要求。DSO和相关责任方可以放松上述要求。这种放松可能是针对整个电厂或特定发电厂或特定发电技术的。注1：发电单元制造商在设计发电单元输出侧的尺寸时有一定的自由度，以满足本文件的要求（例如由于电压变化或无功功率交换）。这在图12中的“设计自由区域”中有所表示。在请求时，制造商应向所有相关方提供信息，说明关于有功功率能力相对于无功功率要求及在运行电压范围内的功率等级的实际选择（详见本条款后文）。发电单元的产品文档中应包含P-Q图。注2：如果DSO和生产商之间达成一致，发电厂可能会根据图12提供额外的可选无功功率能力，以提供额外的电网支持。在一些国家，某些技术可能根据法律要求普遍需要这种能力。注3：如果DSO和生产商之间达成一致，发电厂可能会提供额外的要求（例如连续的无功功率补偿或不考虑主要能源可用性的连续无功功率运行）。注4：在过电压情况下，如果DSO和生产商之间达成一致，可以进行额外的无功功率交换，直到额定电流（从而增加视在功率），如果超过视在功率阈值Smin（等于最大视在功率Smax的10%或发电厂的最低调节水平，以较高者为准），则无功功率能力应以±2% Smax的精度提供。在该视在功率阈值Smin以下，允许超过2%的偏差；然而，精度应始终尽可能好，并且在此低功率运行模式下，不受控的无功功率交换不得超过最大视在功率Smax的10%。在生产商的网络中存在POC（可能的负载）时，可能会干扰发电厂的响应。在评估精度时，不考虑负载的影响，只考虑发电厂的行为。对于按照图12具有无功功率能力的发电单元，在有功功率PD下的无功功率能力至少应符合图13的要求。对于具有降低无功功率能力的发电单元，图13仅适用于最大无功功率能力范围内。在低于Un电压时，可以按照4.4.4的规定减少视在功率。注6：在达到最大视在功率时，是否有优先考虑P（有功功率）、Q（无功功率）或有功因数，本欧洲标准中未作定义。不同优先级方法的风险和好处正在考虑之中。
trl:

IF Operator = 发电厂 AND Target = 发电单元 AND Capacity <= 150kVA
THEN PowerResponse = 有功因数运行在cosφ=0.95欠励到cosφ=0.95过励
rule 2
IF Operator = 发电厂 AND Target = 直接连接至电网且高于微发电级别的感应发电机发电单元
THEN PowerResponse = 有功因数运行在cosφ=0.95欠励到cosφ=1过励
rule 3

THEN PowerResponse = 有功因数运行高于0.95
rule 4
IF Operator = 发电厂 AND Target = 直接且同步连接至电网的线性发电机发电单元
THEN PowerResponse = 有功因数运行高于0.95
rule 5
IF Operator = 发电厂 AND Target = 发电单元
THEN PowerResponse = 按特定技术要求提供无功功率电压支持
rule 6

THEN PowerResponse = 可放松上述要求针对整个电厂或特定发电厂或特定发电技术

rule 1

then 功率响应 = 有功因数运行在cosφ=0.95欠励到cosφ=0.95过励
rule 2
if 操作人 = 发电厂 and 操作对象 = 直接连接至电网且高于微发电级别的感应发电机发电单元
then 功率响应 = 有功因数运行在cosφ=0.95欠励到cosφ=1过励
rule 3
if 操作人 = 发电厂 and 操作对象 = 微发电厂中直接连接至电网的感应发电机发电单元
then 功率响应 = 有功因数运行高于0.95
rule 4
if 操作人 = 发电厂 and 操作对象 = 直接且同步连接至电网的线性发电机发电单元
then 功率响应 = 有功因数运行高于0.95
rule 5
if 操作人 = 发电厂 and 操作对象 = 发电单元
then 功率响应 = 按特定技术要求提供无功功率电压支持
rule 6
if 操作人 = DSO and 操作对象 = 发电厂
then 功率响应 = 可放松上述要求针对整个电厂或特定发电厂或特定发电技术

testcase.功率响应: 有功因数运行在cosφ=0.95欠励到cosφ=0.95过励

testcase.操作对象: 直接连接至电网且高于微发电级别的感应发电机发电单元
testcase.功率响应: 有功因数运行在cosφ=0.95欠励到cosφ=1过励

testcase.操作对象: 微发电厂中直接连接至电网的感应发电机发电单元
直接且同步连接至电网的线性发电机发电单元

testcase.功率响应: 按特定技术要求提供无功功率电压支持

rule: 4.7.2.3 Control modes

4.7.2.3.1 General: Where required, the form of the contribution to voltage control shall be specified by the DSO. The control shall refer to the terminals of the generating units. The generating plant/unit shall be capable of operating in the control modes specified below within the limits specified in 4.7.2.2. The control modes are exclusive; only one mode may be active at a time. Q setpoint mode, Q (U), Cos φ setpoint mode, Cos φ (P). For mass market products, it is recommended to implement all control modes. In case of site specific generating plant design, only the control modes required by the DSO need to be implemented. The configuration, activation and deactivation of the control modes shall be field adjustable. For field adjustable configurations and activation of the active control mode, means shall be provided to protect the settings from unpermitted interference (e.g. password or seal) if required by the DSO. Which control modes are available in a product and how they are configured shall be stated in the product documentation.
rule_cn: 4.7.2.3.1 一般规定：如需，电压控制的贡献形式应由配电系统运营商（DSO）规定。控制应针对发电单元的端子进行。发电厂/单元应在4.7.2.2中规定的限值范围内，具备在以下控制模式下运行的能力。这些控制模式互斥，同一时间只能有一个模式处于激活状态。控制模式包括：无功功率设定值模式（Q setpoint mode，Q（U））、功率因数设定值模式（Cos φ setpoint mode，Cos φ（P））。对于大众市场产品，建议实现所有控制模式。对于特定站点设计的发电厂，只需实现DSO要求的控制模式。控制模式的配置、激活和停用应在现场进行调整。如DSO要求，应提供防止未经授权干扰的保护措施（如密码或封条）以保障设置的安全。产品文档中应明确说明该产品支持哪些控制模式及其配置方式。
trl:
rule 1
IF Operator = DSO AND Target = 发电厂
THEN Voltage = 由DSO规定的控制贡献形式
rule 2
IF Target = 发电单元
THEN Voltage = 控制针对端子进行
rule 3
IF Target = 发电厂 OR Target = 发电单元
THEN Status = 激活单一控制模式
rule 4
IF ControlMode = Q setpoint mode OR ControlMode = Cos φ setpoint mode
THEN Status = 可选激活
rule 5
IF Operator = DSO AND Target = 发电厂
THEN Protection = 防止未经授权干扰
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 操作人 = DSO and 操作对象 = 发电厂
then 电压 = 由DSO规定的控制贡献形式
rule 2
if 操作对象 = 发电单元
then 电压 = 控制针对端子进行
rule 3
if 操作对象 = 发电厂
then 状态 = 激活单一控制模式
rule 4
if 操作对象 = 发电单元
then 状态 = 激活单一控制模式
rule 5
if ControlMode = Q setpoint mode
then 状态 = 可选激活
rule 6
if ControlMode = Cos φ setpoint mode
then 状态 = 可选激活
rule 7
if 操作人 = DSO and 操作对象 = 发电厂
then 保护机制 = 防止未经授权干扰

testcase.电压: 由DSO规定的控制贡献形式

rule: 4.7.2.3.2 Setpoint control modes: Q setpoint mode and cos φ setpoint mode control the reactive power output and the cos φ of the output respectively, according to a set point set in the control of the generating plant/unit. In the case of change of the set point local or by remote control the settling time for the new set point shall be less than one minute.
rule_cn: 4.7.2.3.2 设定值控制模式：Q设定值模式和cos φ设定值模式分别根据发电厂/单元控制中的设定值，控制无功功率输出和输出的cos φ值。在设定值本地或远程发生变化时，新的设定值达到稳定状态的时间应小于一分钟。
trl:
rule 1
IF Operator = 发电厂 AND Target = 单元 AND Action = Q设定值模式
THEN PowerResponse = 控制无功功率输出
rule 2
IF Operator = 发电厂 AND Target = 单元 AND Action = cos φ设定值模式
THEN PowerResponse = 控制输出的cos φ值
rule 3
IF Action = Q设定值模式 OR Action = cos φ设定值模式 AND Status = 新设定值变化
THEN Duration <= 1min
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 操作 = Q设定值模式 and 操作人 = 发电厂 and 操作对象 = 单元
then 功率响应 = 控制无功功率输出
rule 2
if 操作 = cos φ设定值模式 and 操作人 = 发电厂 and 操作对象 = 单元
then 功率响应 = 控制输出的cos φ值
rule 3
if 操作 = Q设定值模式 and 状态 = 新设定值变化
then Duration <= 1min
rule 4
if 操作 = cos φ设定值模式 and 状态 = 新设定值变化
then Duration <= 1min

rule: 4.7.2.3.3 Voltage related control mode: The voltage related control mode Q (U) controls the reactive power output as a function of the voltage. There is no preferred state of the art for evaluating the voltage. Therefore it is the responsibility of the generating plant designer to choose a method. One of the following methods should be used: • the positive sequence component of the fundamental; • the average of the voltages measured independently for each phase to neutral or phase to phase; phase independently the voltage of every phase to determine the reactive power for every phase. For voltage related control modes, a characteristic with a minimum and maximum value and three connected lines according to Figure 16 shall be configurable. In addition to the characteristic, further parameters shall be configurable: The dynamics of the control shall correspond with a first order filter having a time constant that is configurable in the range of 3 s to 60 s. NOTE 1: The time to perform 95 % of the changed set point due to a change in voltage will be 3 times the time constant. NOTE 2: The dynamic response of the generating units to voltage changes is not considered here. The response to disturbances as in 4.5 and short circuit current requirements as in 4.7.4 is not included in this clause. NOTE 3: An intentional delay is under consideration. To limit the reactive power at low active power two methods shall be configurable: a minimal cos φ shall be configurable in the range of 0-0,95; two active power levels shall be configurable both at least in the range of 0 % to 100 % of PD. The lock-in value turns the Q(U) mode on, the lock-out value turns Q(U) off. If lock-in is larger than lock-out a hysteresis is given. See also Figure 14. The static accuracy shall be in accordance with 4.7.2.2. The dynamic accuracy shall be in accordance with Figure 15 with a maximum tolerance of +/- 5% of PD plus a time delay of up to 3 seconds deviating from an ideal first order filter response.
rule_cn:
4.7.2.3.3 与电压相关的控制模式：与电压相关的控制模式Q（U）通过电压来控制无功功率输出。目前尚无评估电压的首选方法。因此，发电厂设计者应自行选择一种方法。应采用以下方法之一：  
• 基波的正序分量；  
• 独立测量每相相电压或相间电压的平均值；  
• 独立测量每相的电压以确定每相的无功功率。  

对于与电压相关的控制模式，应可配置具有最小值和最大值，并按照图16所示连接三条线的特性曲线。除了特性曲线外，还应可配置其他参数：  
控制的动态特性应对应于一个一阶滤波器，其时间常数可在3秒至60秒之间进行配置。  
注1：由于电压变化导致95%的设定值变化所需的时间为3倍的时间常数。  
注2：本条款未考虑发电机组对电压变化的动态响应。4.5条所述的扰动响应以及4.7.4条所述的短路电流要求也不包含在本条款中。  
注3：正在考虑有意设置的延迟。  
为限制在低有功功率时的无功功率，应可配置两种方法：  
• 可配置最小功率因数cos φ，范围为0至0.95；  
• 可配置两个有功功率水平，两者至少应在PD的0%至100%范围内。  

锁入值将开启Q(U)模式，锁出值将关闭Q(U)模式。如果锁入值大于锁出值，则具有迟滞特性。参见图14。  

静态精度应符合4.7.2.2条的规定。  
动态精度应符合图15的规定，最大容差为PD的±5%，并允许与理想一阶滤波器响应相比有最多3秒的延迟。
trl:
rule 1
IF Operator = 发电厂 AND Target = Q(U)模式
THEN Status = 激活
rule 2
IF 电压 >= 锁入值
THEN Status = 激活
rule 3
IF 电压 <= 锁出值
THEN Status = 停用
rule 4
IF Status = 激活 AND Duration >= 3s AND Duration <= 60s
THEN PowerResponse = 按一阶滤波器动态特性响应
rule 5
IF PowerResponse = 运行中
THEN PowerResponse = 精度在PD±5%
rule 6
IF PowerResponse = 运行中 AND Duration <= 3s延迟
THEN PowerResponse = 容许延迟
rule 7
IF PowerResponse = 运行中 AND 有功功率 <= PD
THEN PowerResponse = 限制在最小功率因数cosφ 0至0.95或有功功率水平0至100%范围内
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 操作人 = 发电厂 and 操作对象 = QU模式
then 状态 = 激活
rule 2
if 电压 >= 锁入值
then 状态 = 激活
rule 3
if 电压 <= 锁出值
then 状态 = 停用
rule 4
if 状态 = 激活 and Duration >= 3s and Duration <= 60s
then 功率响应 = 按一阶滤波器动态特性响应
rule 5
if 功率响应 = 运行中
then 功率响应 = 精度在PD±5%
rule 6
if 功率响应 = 运行中 and Duration <= 3s延迟
then 功率响应 = 容许延迟
rule 7
if 功率响应 = 运行中 and 有功功率 <= PD
then 功率响应 = 限制在最小功率因数cosφ 0至0.95或有功功率水平0至100%范围内

testcase.功率响应: 按一阶滤波器动态特性响应

rule: 4.7.2.3.4 Power related control mode: The power related control mode cos (P) controls the cos φ of the output as a function of the active power output. For power related control modes, a characteristic with a minimum and maximum value and three connected lines shall be configurable in accordance with Figure 16. Resulting from a change in active power output a new cos φ set point is defined according to the set characteristic. The response to a new cos φ set value shall be as fast as technically feasible to allow the change in reactive power to be in synchrony with the change in active power. The new reactive power set value shall be reached at the latest within 10 s after the end value of the active power is reached. The static accuracy of each cos φ set point shall be according to 4.7.2.2.
rule_cn: 4.7.2.3.4 与功率相关的控制模式：与功率相关的控制模式cos（P）通过有功功率输出来控制输出的功率因数cosφ。对于与功率相关的控制模式，应根据图16配置具有最小值和最大值以及三条连接线的特性曲线。当有功功率输出发生变化时，应根据设定的特性曲线定义一个新的cosφ设定值。对新的cosφ设定值的响应应尽可能快，以使无功功率的变化与有功功率的变化保持同步。新的无功功率设定值应在有功功率达到最终值后最多10秒内达到。每个cosφ设定值的静态精度应符合4.7.2.2的规定。
trl:
rule 1
IF PowerResponse = 输出变化
THEN PowerResponse = 更新cosφ设定值
rule 2
IF PowerResponse = 更新cosφ设定值
THEN Duration <= 10s
rule 3
IF PowerResponse = 更新cosφ设定值
THEN PowerResponse = 响应尽可能快
rule 4
IF PowerResponse = 更新cosφ设定值
THEN PowerResponse = 精度符合4.7.2.2规定
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 功率响应 = 输出变化
then 功率响应 = 更新cosφ设定值
rule 2
if 功率响应 = 更新cosφ设定值
then Duration <= 10s
rule 3
if 功率响应 = 更新cosφ设定值
then 功率响应 = 响应尽可能快
rule 4
if 功率响应 = 更新cosφ设定值
then 功率响应 = 精度符合4.7.2.2规定

rule: 4.7.3 Voltage related active power reduction: In order to avoid disconnection due to overvoltage protection (see 4.9.2.3 and 4.9.2.4), generating plants/units are allowed to reduce active power output as a function of this rising voltage. The final implemented logic can be chosen by the manufacturer. Nevertheless, this logic shall not cause steps or oscillations in the output power. The power reduction caused by such a function shall not be faster than the equivalent of a first order filter with a time constant tau=3 s. The enabling and disabling of the function shall be field adjustable and means have to be provided to protect the setting from unpermitted interference (e.g. password or seal) if required by the DSO.
rule_cn: 4.7.3 与电压相关的有功功率削减：为避免因过电压保护（参见4.9.2.3和4.9.2.4）而导致断开，发电厂/机组可按照电压上升的情况削减有功功率输出。制造商可以选择最终实施的逻辑。然而，该逻辑不得导致输出功率出现阶跃或振荡。此类功能所引起的功率削减速度，不得快于等效于时间常数tau=3秒的一阶滤波器。该功能的启用和禁用应可在现场进行调整，如果电网调度机构（DSO）要求，还应提供防止未经授权干扰的保护措施（例如密码或封条）。
trl:
rule 1
IF Operator = 发电厂 AND Target = 机组 AND Voltage = 上升
THEN PowerResponse = 削减
rule 2
IF PowerResponse = 削减
THEN PowerResponse = 不出现阶跃或振荡
rule 3
IF PowerResponse = 削减
THEN Duration >= 3s
rule 4
IF Operator = 发电厂 AND Target = 机组
THEN PowerResponse = 可启用或禁用
rule 5
IF Operator = DSO AND Target = 发电厂
THEN Protection = 防止未经授权干扰
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 电压 = 上升 and 操作人 = 发电厂 and 操作对象 = 机组
then 功率响应 = 削减
rule 2
if 功率响应 = 削减
then 功率响应 = 不出现阶跃或振荡
rule 3
if 功率响应 = 削减
then Duration >= 3s
rule 4
if 操作人 = 发电厂 and 操作对象 = 机组
then 功率响应 = 可启用或禁用
rule 5
if 操作人 = DSO and 操作对象 = 发电厂
then 保护机制 = 防止未经授权干扰

rule: 4.7.4 Short circuit current requirements on generating plants
rule_cn: 4.7.4 发电设施的短路电流要求

rule: 4.7.4.1 General: The following clauses describe the required short circuit current contribution for generating plants taking into account the connection technology of the generating modules. Generating modules classified as type B modules according to COMMISSION REGULATION 2016/631 shall comply with the requirements of 4.7.4.2 and 4.7.4.3. Generating modules classified as type A according to COMMISSION REGULATION 2016/631 should comply with these requirements. The actual behaviour of type A modules shall be specified in the connection agreement. NOTE: Based on the chosen banding threshold it is considered necessary to include generating modules classified as type A if connected to medium voltage distribution grids. Exemption is only acceptable for CHP and generating units based on rotating machinery below 50 kW as EN 50465 for gas appliance requests disconnection in case of under voltage.
rule_cn: 4.7.4.1 总则：以下条款描述了发电厂在考虑发电模块连接技术的情况下，所需提供的短路电流贡献。根据欧盟委员会条例2016/631被归类为B型模块的发电模块，应符合4.7.4.2和4.7.4.3的要求。根据欧盟委员会条例2016/631被归类为A型模块的发电模块应遵守这些要求。A型模块的实际行为应在接入协议中明确规定。注：根据所选的带宽阈值，认为有必要将连接到中压配电网的被归类为A型的发电模块纳入考虑范围。只有在CHP（联合供热供能）和基于旋转机械、功率低于50kW的发电单元在电压不足时根据EN 50465标准要求断开的情况下，才可免除相关要求。
trl:
rule 1
IF Operator = 发电厂 AND Target = 发电模块 AND ModuleType = B型
THEN Status = 遵守4.7.4.2和4.7.4.3要求
rule 2
IF Operator = 发电厂 AND Target = 发电模块 AND ModuleType = A型
THEN Status = 遵守4.7.4.1要求 AND Status = 接入协议中明确规定实际行为
rule 3
IF ModuleType = A型 AND ConnectedTo = 中压配电网 AND BandwidthThreshold = 已选
THEN Status = 纳入考虑范围
rule 4
IF ModuleType = CHP OR (ModuleType = 旋转机械 AND Power < 50kW AND Voltage = 不足)
THEN Status = 可免除相关要求
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 操作人 = 发电厂 and 操作对象 = 发电模块 and ModuleType = B型
then 状态 = 遵守4.7.4.2和4.7.4.3要求
rule 2
if 操作人 = 发电厂 and 操作对象 = 发电模块 and ModuleType = A型
then 状态 = 遵守4.7.4.1要求 and 状态 = 接入协议中明确规定实际行为
rule 3
if ModuleType = A型 and ConnectedTo = 中压配电网 and BandwidthThreshold = 已选
then 状态 = 纳入考虑范围
rule 4
if 电压 = 不足 and ModuleType = CHP and Power < 50kW
then 状态 = 可免除相关要求
rule 5
if 电压 = 不足 and ModuleType = 旋转机械 and Power < 50kW
then 状态 = 可免除相关要求

testcase.状态2: 接入协议中明确规定实际行为

rule: 4.7.4.2 Generating plant with non-synchronous generating technology
rule_cn: 4.7.4.2 非同步发电技术的发电厂

rule: 4.7.4.2.1 Voltage support during faults and voltage steps: In general no voltage support during faults and voltage steps is required from generating plants connected in LV distribution networks as the additional reactive current is expected to interfere with grid protection equipment. If the responsible party requires voltage support during faults and voltage steps for generating plants of type B connected to LV distribution grids, the clause 4.7.4 of EN 50549-2 applies.
rule_cn: 4.7.4.2.1 故障及电压阶跃期间的电压支持：通常情况下，连接至低压配电网的发电厂在故障及电压阶跃期间无需提供电压支持，因为额外的无功电流预计会干扰电网保护设备。如果相关责任方要求对连接至低压配电网的B类发电厂在故障及电压阶跃期间提供电压支持，则应适用EN 50549-2标准第4.7.4条。
trl:
rule 1
IF Fault = 发生 AND Voltage = 阶跃 AND Target = 连接至低压配电网的发电厂 AND Operator = 责任方未要求
THEN PowerResponse = 不提供电压支持
rule 2
IF Fault = 发生 AND Voltage = 阶跃 AND Target = 连接至低压配电网的B类发电厂 AND Operator = 责任方要求
THEN PowerResponse = 提供电压支持 AND Status = 遵循EN50549-2第4.7.4条
trl_postprocess:
rule 1
if 电压 = 阶跃 and 操作人 = 责任方未要求 and 操作对象 = 连接至低压配电网的发电厂 and 故障类型 = 发生
then 功率响应 = 不提供电压支持
rule 2
if 电压 = 阶跃 and 操作人 = 责任方要求 and 操作对象 = 连接至低压配电网的B类发电厂 and 故障类型 = 发生
then 状态 = 遵循EN50549-2第4.7.4条 and 功率响应 = 提供电压支持

testcase.操作对象: 连接至低压配电网的发电厂
连接至低压配电网的B类发电厂

rule: 4.7.4.2.2 Zero current mode for converter connected generating technology: If UVRT capability (see 4.5.3) is provided additional to the requirements of 4.5, generating units connected to the grid by a converter shall have the capability to reduce their current as fast as technically feasible down to or below 10 % of the rated current when the voltage is outside of a static voltage range. Generating units based on a doubly fed induction machine can only reduce the positive sequence current below 10 % of the rated current. Negative sequence current shall be tolerated during unbalanced faults. In case this current reduction is not sufficient, the DSO should choose suitable interface protection settings. The static voltage range shall be adjustable from 20 % to 100 % of Un for the undervoltage boundary and from 100 % to 130 % of Un for the overvoltage boundary. The default setting shall be 50% of Un for the undervoltage boundary and 120% of Un for the overvoltage boundary. Each phase to neutral voltage or if no neutral is present each phase to phase voltage shall be evaluated. At voltage re-entry into the voltage range, 90% of pre-fault power or available power, whichever is the smallest, shall be resumed as fast as possible, but at the latest according to 4.5.3 and 4.5.4. All described settings are defined by the DSO and the responsible party. If no settings are provided, the function shall be disabled. The enabling and disabling and the settings shall be field adjustable and means have to be provided to protect these from unpermitted interference (e.g. password or seal) if required by the DSO.
rule_cn: 4.7.4.2.2 逆变器连接发电技术的零电流模式：如果除了满足第4.5条的要求外，还具备电压跌落恢复（UVRT）能力（见4.5.3），则通过逆变器接入电网的发电单元应在电压超出静态电压范围时，尽可能快地将电流降低至额定电流的10%以下或更低。基于双馈感应电机的发电单元只能将正序电流降低至额定电流的10%以下。在不对称故障期间，负序电流是可以接受的。如果这种电流降低不足以满足要求，电网服务提供者（DSO）应选择合适的接口保护设置。静态电压范围的下限应可在额定电压Un的20%至100%之间调节，上限则应在Un的100%至130%之间调节。默认设置为：电压下限为Un的50%，电压上限为Un的120%。应对每相与中性点之间的电压进行评估，如果不存在中性点，则应对每相与每相之间的电压进行评估。当电压重新进入电压范围时，应尽快恢复至故障前功率或可用功率中较小的那个值的90%，但最迟应按照4.5.3和4.5.4的规定进行恢复。所有上述设置均由DSO和相关责任方定义。如果没有设置，则该功能应被禁用。该功能的启用与禁用以及相关设置应可在现场进行调整，并且如果DSO要求，应提供防止未经授权干扰的保护措施（例如密码或封条）。

rule: 4.7.4.2.3 Induction generator based units: In general no voltage support during faults and voltage steps is required from generating plants connected in LV distribution networks as the additional reactive current is expected to interfere with grid protection equipment. If the responsible party requires voltage support during faults and voltage steps for generating plants of type B connected to LV distribution grids, the clause 4.7.4 of EN50549-2 applies.
rule_cn: 4.7.4.2.3 基于感应发电机的单元：通常情况下，连接在低压配电网中的发电厂在发生故障和电压波动时无需提供电压支持，因为额外的无功电流预计会干扰电网保护设备。如果责任方要求对连接到低压配电网的B类发电机组在故障和电压波动期间提供电压支持，则应适用EN50549-2标准第4.7.4条。
